articles.title: Why Bone Health Is Finally Having a Moment
articles.summary: Bone health is finally having its moment in the femtech space. Awareness is growing for preventing osteoporosis and fractures through increased monitoring and proactive treatments.

articles.title: Oxolife Develops First-in-Class Treatments for PCOS and IVF Implantation Challenges
articles.summary: Oxolife is developing a novel compound, Oxo-1, that addresses PCOS treatment and enhances embryo implantation. The compound has shown promising results in increasing pregnancy and live birth rates in animal models and clinical trials.

articles.title: Withings Partners with Clue to Integrate Health Data with Cycle Tracking
articles.summary: Withings and Clue have partnered to integrate health data from the Withings ScanWatch 2 with Clue Plus for comprehensive cycle tracking. The collaboration will provide women with insights into how hormonal fluctuations impact their overall health.

articles.title: Mercy BioAnalytics Raises $59M Series B for Early Ovarian Cancer Detection Technology
articles.summary: Mercy BioAnalytics has raised $59M in a Series B funding round to advance its liquid biopsies for early ovarian cancer detection. The funds will support commercialization of the ovarian cancer test and expansion into other cancer screening tests.

articles.title: Seven Starling Raises $8M to Expand Women’s Mental Health Platform in the US
articles.summary: Seven Starling has raised $8M in funding to expand its maternal mental health platform across the US. The platform provides virtual behavioral health services specializing in fertility, pregnancy, postpartum, and early parenthood.

articles.title: Parento Raises $5.9M Seed II to Expand Paid Parental Leave Insurance for Small Businesses
articles.summary: Parento has raised $5.9 million in Seed II funding to expand its paid parental leave insurance platform for small businesses. The funding will help expand across product development, sales, and marketing teams.

articles.title: What’s New in Femtech This Week? (Sep 18, 2025)
articles.summary: This week's femtech newsletter highlights funding for Diana Health, Conceivable Life Sciences, and Evela Health.  It also covers Medicines360's acquisition of PeriPeach and GG Ventures' new fund for AI-native healthtech for women.

articles.title: Evela Health Completes €2M Funding Round to Transform Menopause Care in German-Speaking Markets
articles.summary: Evela Health has completed a €2 million funding round to expand its evidence-based menopause care platform in German-speaking markets. The platform combines personalized consultations, a knowledge base, and ongoing support.

articles.title: Medicines360 Acquires Global Rights to PeriPeach Device for Preventing Severe Perineal Tears
articles.summary: Medicines360 has acquired global rights to PeriPeach, a device designed to prevent severe perineal tears during childbirth, through its 360 Innovation Hub. The device aims to reduce obstetric anal sphincter injuries (OASIS) during vaginal delivery.

articles.title: The Next Generation of Work and Family
articles.summary: A new wave of femtech products are aiming to make autonomy less costly and less lonely. This article discusses what the products of the future will look like in the space of balancing work and family.

articles.title: Italy’s Femtech Ecosystem Shows Promise Despite Funding Gaps and Operational Barriers
articles.summary: A new study by Tech4Fem's FemTech Observatory indicates that Italy's femtech sector includes 92 companies but faces funding challenges and operational barriers. While innovation is strong, sustainable growth requires addressing these systemic issues.

articles.title: FDA Approves First Medical Device for Asherman Syndrome Treatment
articles.summary: The FDA has approved Womed Leaf, the first medical device specifically for treating Asherman syndrome, a condition causing intrauterine adhesions. The resorbable adhesion barrier is designed to prevent the return of scarring in the uterus.

articles.title: Conceivable Life Sciences Raises $50M Series A for US Launch of Automated IVF Lab
articles.summary: Conceivable Life Sciences has raised $50 million to develop its AI-powered automated IVF laboratory platform, AURA. The platform aims to standardize IVF procedures and reduce variability in outcomes using robotics and AI algorithms.

articles.title: Ultrahuman Partners with Clue to Integrate Biomarker Data with Cycle Tracking
articles.summary: Ultrahuman and Clue have partnered to integrate biomarker data from Ultrahuman Ring AIR with the Clue app. The collaboration allows users to combine cycle tracking with physiological measurements for a comprehensive view of women's health.

articles.title: GG Ventures Raises $30M in First Close to Invest in AI-Native Healthtech for Women
articles.summary: GG Ventures has raised $30M in the first close of its new fund to invest in AI-native healthtech companies focused on female performance, longevity, and wellness. The firm targets companies from seed to Series A stage.

articles.title: Diana Health Raises $55M Series C to Expand Hospital-Partnered Women’s Health Network
articles.summary: Diana Health has raised $55M in Series C funding to expand its hospital-partnered women's health network using a midwifery model of care. The company serves over 80,000 women annually across multiple states.

articles.title: Missing first screening appt raises breast cancer death risk – study
articles.summary: A new study finds women who miss their first mammogram face a 40% higher risk of dying from breast cancer, due to later detection. Targeting interventions to boost screening adherence could cut breast cancer deaths.

articles.title: One in three Europeans unfamiliar with cystitis and UTIs, survey finds
articles.summary: A survey reveals that 35% of Europeans can't identify cystitis as a bladder infection, and young women show limited knowledge of prevention. Experts emphasize raising awareness to prevent infections and slow antibiotic resistance.

articles.title: Researcher uses AI to improve menopause care
articles.summary: Dr. Charlotte Woolley is using AI to study menopause care in Greater Manchester, aiming to ensure equitable support for women from all backgrounds. Her research combines women's experiences with large health datasets.

articles.title: Creatine offers menopause benefits, study finds
articles.summary: Research suggests that creatine supplements may improve sleep quality, body composition, and cognitive function in perimenopausal and menopausal women. The study showed improvements in hormonal health and muscle strength after 14 weeks of use.

articles.title: Round up: funding for world’s first AI-powered IVF lab, and more
articles.summary: This article discusses recent funding for Conceivable Life Sciences' AI-powered IVF lab platform. Also covers Truelli's smart menstrual pad development and other key investments in women's health technology.

articles.title: Mammograms may benefit women well into their 80s, study finds
articles.summary: A new study finds mammograms may benefit women well into their 80s, showing lower death and recurrence risks. Early detection means less invasive treatment is often needed in postmenopausal women.

articles.title: Wrist cooling could help managing hot flash study finds
articles.summary: Research shows a wrist cooling device can reduce severe hot flash episodes in breast cancer patients, prostate cancer patients, and postmenopausal women. The device lowers hot flash frequency by 18%.

articles.title: Tens of thousands demand menstrual leave to be written into UK law
articles.summary: More than 65,000 people have signed a petition for menstrual leave to be added to UK employment rights law. The petition calls for protections that include no loss of pay, benefits, or seniority.

articles.title: Long covid linked to longer, heavier periods
articles.summary: A study involving more than 12,000 women has linked long COVID to abnormal menstrual bleeding, such as longer and heavier periods. Those with long COVID also experienced fluctuating symptoms with their cycle.

articles.title: Hospitals roll out gene testing for newborns in national study
articles.summary: UK hospitals have initiated gene testing for newborns to screen for over 200 rare genetic conditions.  The Generation Study aims to test 100,000 babies and will run through March 2027.

articles.title: Starting menopause therapy early may lower Alzheimer’s risk, study finds
articles.summary: Research indicates that beginning hormone replacement therapy (HRT) soon after menopause may reduce Alzheimer's risk by 22-32%. Starting at 65 or later may elevate risks.

articles.title: UK’s first Pink Duck Race raises thousands for breast cancer
articles.summary: The UK's first Pink Duck Race in Cambridge raised thousands for breast cancer support by floating 5,000 rubber ducks down the River Cam. The race was launched to support Think Pink Europe.

articles.title: Endometriosis linked to hundreds of conditions across the body, study finds
articles.summary: A study analyzing millions of health records revealed endometriosis is connected to more than 600 conditions. Findings ranged from reproductive and autoimmune disorders to migraines, asthma and gastrointestinal conditions.

articles.title: IVF innovation: What you need to know about global regulatory pathways in 2025
articles.summary: FinDBest IVF's founder explores the global regulatory pathways for IVF innovations in 2025.  Key areas discussed include: United States, China, European Union, ASEAN, Latin America, Middle East, Australia & New Zealand.

companies: Oxolife, Withings, Clue, Mercy BioAnalytics, Seven Starling, Parento, Diana Health, Conceivable Life Sciences, Evela Health, Medicines360, PeriPeach, GG Ventures, Womed Leaf, Ultrahuman, Truelli, FinDBest IVF
